dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.subtitle: Free Trial Helper
dashboard.adminWarningDesc: Some features may require elevated permissions to work properly.

reset.title: Reset Machine ID
reset.subtitle: Generate new machine identifiers to reset trial status
reset.features: This feature generates new machine identifiers and updates various system files to reset your trial status. It modifies identification data across Cursor's configuration files and system registry, making the application recognize your system as a new installation. All changes are automatically backed up before modifications are made.
reset.warning: Cursor will be closed automatically before resetting. Make sure to save your work first.
reset.success: Machine IDs have been reset successfully. Please restart Cursor.

update.title: Disable Auto-Update
update.subtitle: Prevent Cursor from automatically updating to newer versions
update.features: This feature prevents Cursor from automatically updating to newer versions by modifying update-related configuration files. It removes update components and locks update settings, ensuring the application stays at the current version. All changes are applied across necessary configuration areas to block automatic updates.
update.warning: Cursor will be closed automatically. You will not receive automatic updates after this.

token.title: Token Limit Adjustment
token.subtitle: Modify workbench to increase token limits
token.features: This feature modifies Cursor's core application files to increase token limits and hide trial indicators in the interface. It updates the token limit function to allow higher limits and modifies interface elements to display Pro status instead of trial indicators.
token.warning: Cursor will be closed automatically. A backup will be created before modification.
token.success: Token limit adjustment applied successfully. Please restart Cursor.

quit.title: Quit Cursor
quit.subtitle: Close all running Cursor processes
quit.features: This feature forcefully closes all running Cursor processes, ensuring the application is completely shut down. It terminates all Cursor-related processes across the system, which is necessary before making modifications to Cursor's files. This ensures files are not locked and can be safely modified.
quit.success: All Cursor processes have been closed.

totallyReset.title: Totally Reset Cursor
totallyReset.subtitle: Complete removal of all Cursor settings and data
totallyReset.features: This feature performs a complete reset of Cursor by removing all application settings, cached data, and configuration files. It deletes all Cursor-related data directories and resets machine identifiers to create a fresh installation state. Your code files are not affected - only Cursor editor files and settings are removed.
totallyReset.note: Your code files will NOT be affected. Only Cursor AI editor files are removed.
totallyReset.confirmMessage: This will permanently delete all Cursor settings and data. This action cannot be undone.
totallyReset.successNote: Please restart your system for full effect. You will need to reinstall Cursor.

auth.title: Manual Authentication
auth.subtitle: Manually set your Cursor authentication credentials
auth.features: This feature allows you to manually set your Cursor authentication credentials without going through the standard login process. It updates your account information and session tokens in Cursor's local storage, enabling you to authenticate with credentials obtained from other sources. The changes are applied across all necessary configuration areas to ensure proper authentication.
auth.tokenHint: From browser cookies - extract the part after %3A%3A or ::
auth.error: Please enter both email and token

multiAccount.title: Multi-Account Manager
multiAccount.subtitle: Manage multiple Cursor accounts and switch between them
multiAccount.features: This feature allows you to create and manage multiple Cursor accounts. You can create accounts within the app, which saves them to a JSON file in your Documents folder. You can also import accounts from a JSON file if you've exported them before. When switching accounts, Cursor will be completely reset first to ensure a clean switch. The accounts file is stored in your Documents folder and you are responsible for keeping it safe.
multiAccount.dataSafety: Important: Keep your accounts JSON file safe. It contains sensitive authentication data. Do not share it publicly.
multiAccount.noAccounts: No accounts found. Create your first account to get started.
multiAccount.fillAllFields: Please fill in all required fields
multiAccount.importedFileNote: New accounts will be saved to the imported file.
multiAccount.switchWarning: Switching accounts will reset Cursor completely and log you out. Are you sure you want to continue?
multiAccount.switchResetWarning: This will perform a complete reset of Cursor (Totally Reset) before switching to the selected account.
multiAccount.switchSuccess: Account switched successfully. Please restart Cursor.
multiAccount.deleteWarning: Are you sure you want to delete this account? This action cannot be undone.
multiAccount.accountNameInfo: A friendly name to identify this account. You can use any name you want.
multiAccount.emailInfo: Your Cursor account email address. This is the email you use to log into Cursor.
multiAccount.accessTokenInfo: Your Cursor access token. Found in Cursor's storage.json file or state.vscdb database. Used to authenticate API requests.
multiAccount.refreshTokenInfo: Your Cursor refresh token (optional). Found in Cursor's storage.json file. Used to refresh expired access tokens.
multiAccount.machineIdInfo: Your machine ID. Automatically captured from your current Cursor session when creating the account. Found in Cursor's storage.json file.
multiAccount.deviceIdInfo: Your device ID. Automatically captured from your current Cursor session when creating the account. Found in Cursor's storage.json file.
multiAccount.createdInfo: The date and time when this account was created in Cursor Free VIP.
multiAccount.accountIdInfo: A unique identifier for this account. Generated automatically when the account is created.

settings.title: Settings
settings.subtitle: Configure application preferences
settings.privacyDesc: Hide sensitive information like email addresses, device IDs, and usernames in file paths. Original data is still copied when selecting or copying text.
settings.author: Author

docs.title: Documentation
docs.gettingStartedDesc: Cursor Free VIP is a free trial helper tool designed to assist with managing your Cursor trial experience. This guide will help you get started.
gettingStartedSteps: Ensure Cursor is installed on your system
Run Cursor Free VIP with administrator privileges for best results
Navigate through the sidebar to access different features
Each feature includes an info button (ℹ️) that explains what it does
Always save your work before using features that close Cursor
docs.featuresDesc: Learn about each feature available in Cursor Free VIP.
docs.resetMachineIdDesc: Generates new machine identifiers to reset your trial status. This feature modifies identification data across Cursor's configuration files and system registry.
docs.manualAuthDesc: Allows you to manually set your Cursor authentication credentials without going through the standard login process.
docs.multiAccountManagerDesc: Create and manage multiple Cursor accounts. Switch between accounts with automatic Cursor reset. Accounts are stored in a JSON file in your Documents folder.
docs.disableUpdateDesc: Prevents Cursor from automatically updating to newer versions by modifying update-related configuration files.
docs.tokenLimitDesc: Modifies Cursor's core application files to increase token limits and hide trial indicators in the interface.
docs.tokenLimitNote: Note: This feature increases token limits and hides trial indicators in the interface, but it does not remove actual trial restrictions such as time limits or feature access restrictions.
docs.quitCursorDesc: Forcefully closes all running Cursor processes, ensuring the application is completely shut down.
docs.totallyResetDesc: Performs a complete reset of Cursor by removing all application settings, cached data, and configuration files.
docs.faqA1: While not always required, administrator privileges are recommended for best results, especially for features that modify system files or registry.
docs.faqQ2: Will this affect my code files?
docs.faqA2: No, Cursor Free VIP only modifies Cursor's configuration and application files. Your code files remain completely untouched.
docs.faqQ3: Do I need to restart Cursor after using features?
docs.faqA3: Yes, most features require restarting Cursor for changes to take effect. The application will prompt you when a restart is needed.
docs.faqA4: Some features automatically create backups before making changes (Reset Machine ID, Token Limit Bypass), but not all features create backups. Features like Totally Reset and Fix Workbench File do not create backups. Always check the log output to see if backups were created.
docs.faqA5: Some features create automatic backups that you can restore from if needed. However, not all features create backups, and some features (like Totally Reset) will reset Cursor to a fresh state, logging you out and removing all settings. You are responsible for your data - use these features at your own risk. Check the log output for backup locations if backups were created.

workbenchFileNotFound.title: File Not Found: workbench.desktop.main.js
workbenchFileNotFound.description: If you encounter a 'File Not Found' error for workbench.desktop.main.js, click the button below to automatically restore the missing file to your Cursor installation.
workbenchFileNotFound.success: Workbench file has been restored successfully. Please restart Cursor.

cursorWrongLocation.title: Cursor Installed in Wrong Location
cursorWrongLocation.description: If fixes like workbench file restoration don't work or you're missing files like product.json, Cursor may be installed in the wrong location. On Windows, Cursor should be in AppData\Local\Programs, not Program Files. This fix will automatically move Cursor to the correct location.
cursorWrongLocation.success: Cursor has been moved to the correct location. Please restart your computer for changes to take effect.
